content.description: Ride the angling crack to the face using some fun handwork. Move up the face to a last large move to crystal jugs on top.Bring a brush and scrub some lichen for any newcomers!Submitter's Dialog:- I know this has been done. I think it should be here, it's a great low-grade problem. I'd imagine the FA has been lost to time, but if anyone knows for sure, let me know.
content.location: Crouch start, in the bottom right of the cave.

content.description:
"Orange Roughy" begins as a sit-start on slopey sidepulls on the beautiful orange dyke thing on the northern side of the boulder. 

  Move the left hand to a gaston, bring the right over it to a decent lie-back/sidepull.  Match and bring the right hand up high on this sidepull thing.Feet are tricky here.  Do a stemming action on both sides of the dyke/sidepulls&slopers.  Move with right hand up and to the sloper, then the left on top above it.Once the left hand is high on the other sloper, reach up with the right to the pinch, I believe, then pop to the jug up top.  It's good up there.

This is a tall boulder on the eastern edge of the gallery to the East of the large, prominent spire on the South side of Mt. Baldy.  When at the "Seul Avec Dieux" Boulder, head in a southeast direction through some small Aspen trees.  About a minute away is the "Orange Roughy" Boulder.  You will recognize this boulder by its color and the chalk.  

   Landings vary depending on the problem.  The boulder's namesake, "Orange Roughy" (V6), has an excellent landing and is worth doing.
